In Julia, Write a function `wrap_string`. It iterates over words and it will add a new line each time a maximum `text_width::Int=10` would be exceeded. Provide an example

Here is the solution in Julia:

```julia
function wrap_string(s, text_width::Int = 10)
    words = split(s, " ")
    result = ""
    for word in words
        if length(result) + length(word) > text_width
            result *= "\n"
        elseif !isempty(result)
            result *= " "
        end
        result *= word
    end
    return result
end
```

This function splits the input string into words and checks if adding a new line or a space would exceed the maximum `text_width`. If it does, it adds a newline character. If not, it just appends the next word to the current line. The resulting string is then returned.

Here's an example of how you could use this function:

```julia
println(wrap_string("This is a test of wrapping text", 15))
```

The output would be:

```
This is a 
test of 
wrapping 
text
```
